授業目的:
This course focuses MIGRATION in the EU. We will discuss this topic from a comparative perspective, comparing the developments in the EU with Japan. Together with students from Europe, we will work on the similarities and difference regarding migration in the EU (with a focus on Germany) and Japan, analysing activities by the government, companies and civil society to attract and integrate migrants.
Students will learn not only migration policies in the EU and Japan, but will also gain 'soft skills' like research skills, discussion skills, and teamwork skills.
到達目標:
Students will understand the similarities and differences regarding migration in Japan and the EU. They will increase their understanding of EU labour migration, German immigration history and policies, as well as the integration of migrants in the labour market and in society in the EU and in Japan.
They will acquire important soft skills regarding independent research, group work, discussion, presentation skills and critical thinking.
